IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we need to connect a new substation to the network for electric vehicle electricity supplies. This equipment controls and delivers electricity into your area. This work is being carried out at night to minimise disruption due to traffic management requirements on site. To connect the new equipment and complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off. Once completed this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in your area and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. This work is taking place on Thorney Way.

This has identified 20 poles that need upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to temporarily take you off the generator to upgrade a transformer pole. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place on Shooters Hatch Road, Pleshey.

This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Butchers Lane and Homefield.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 18:47 - We can confirm that all power in the Dersingham Avenue E12 5 area should be back on.

The issue was due to an underground cable being struck by a third party, which initially caused our substation equipment to operate for safety. Our engineers have now diverted power around the fault. Further work will be carried out on the network.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Hi, Decasta from the messaging team here; just a quick recap on what's happened during the power cut so far. Our engineers are on site in the Dersingham Avenue E12 5 area to repair a damaged cable caused by a third party company. We are still aiming to have the power back on between 21:30-22:30. If your power is back on now, please follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to stop SMS updates. I'm sorry for the continued disruption, but I'll keep you informed with news from site. If you have any concerns, please call us on 08003163105.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 19:46 - We can now confirm that all power in the Oak Avenue area should now be back on. 

We know there was another power cut recently, but following tests made by our engineers they have advised the issues are unrelated, so we don't currently expect this to affect your power again.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the recent outages. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Oak Avenue area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 21:30 and 22:30 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Roland at 19:20.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 03:37 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Wendover Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by a faulty piece of network equipment, which our engineers have replaced.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have investigated and found that the power is off due to an equipment fault on our network which has affected our substation equipment, so we're sending a specialist team to make repairs.

Considering the work that may be required, the revised estimated time to have the power back on is between 04:30 and 05:30.

We're sorry to change the time, but we'll keep you updated with our progress. If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always here to talk on 105. Sent by Theo at 02:03.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Theo at 23:59
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 11:43 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers made partial repairs on the underground network in the Bathurst Gardens area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us that they've been delayed in their works due to some parked cars.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 15:30 and 16:30 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Adam at 11:34.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has now been off for several hours and we're working as quickly as possible to get you back on.

We know you may be concerned about your phone battery running low, so here are some tips on how you can prolong battery life: Set your phone to power saving mode, reduce screen brightness, turn off WiFi, Bluetooth and GPS (if not in use), cut apps running in the background and if possible top up using a car charger or portable battery pack.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 21:59 - We can now confirm that all power in the Ampthill Road MK45 2 area should now be back on. 

We know there was another power cut recently, but following tests made by our engineers they have advised the issues are unrelated, so we don't currently expect this to affect your power again.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the recent outages. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Roland at 21:30 - Our engineers have been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers. We know your power may now be back on; however, we'll keep sending text updates until everyone's electricity is restored. To stop SMS updates, visit our website here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3. If your power is still affected, our engineers have been in touch to advise us that there is a lot of digging required here to safely expose the faulty cable for repairs. Due to this, we're now estimating that we'll have the remaining power restored by 02:30 and 03:30. We're very sorry to adjust our time frame, but we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our specialist engineers are still on their way and are due to arrive on site very soon.

With darkness now upon us we understand that it can be unsettling to have a power cut. It may help to locate a torch and anything else you may need so you can have it to hand just in case.

If you have any concerns please do not hesitate to contact our team, but we will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible. Sent by Roland at 20:51.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 21:33 - We can now confirm that all power in the Hemel Hempstead HP3 area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted power around the faulty underground cables to get the majority of customers back on. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used a temporary generator to restore power to the last of the affected properties. This will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 21:27 - Just a quick update to let you know our temporary generator has arrived and engineers are in the process of connecting it. The power may come back on to your area in stages.

At the moment, we don't need to change the time frame and we'll keep you updated with progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, it's Roland from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be without power and the additional worries this can bring.

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 23:48 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all customers in the CR0 2/3  area, by diverting power around an underground network fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, however we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 22:28 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an underground network fault affecting an estimated 322 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 01:00 and 02:00. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team
